headline: Quick and Easy Peach Cobbler
description: This easy, 5-ingredient peach cobbler comes together in minutes and bakes to sweet perfection in a cast iron skillet. Serve this dessert warm with vanilla ice cream.

video.name: How to Make Quick and Easy Peach Cobbler

name: Quick and Easy Peach Cobbler
recipeIngredient: 2 (16 ounce) cans sliced peaches in heavy syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix self-rising flour, sugar, and milk together in a bowl until well combined and no lumps remain.
Pour melted butter into a 9- or 10-inch cast iron skillet. Pour flour-milk mixture over top.
Carefully pour peaches and syrup into the skillet. Use a spatula to spread peaches evenly around the pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust turns golden brown, 30 to 45 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for about 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I added vanilla that I made and a few drops of almond extract one can mangos and one can peach pie then sprinkled dried cherries. Delicious so easy to change up.
Great to make if you need it the next morning also better in cast iron skillet in my opinion.
I used all purpose flower but added baking powder 1tsp and 1/4tsp of salt. I also added a tsp of cinnamon. It turned out great
Turned out great I added a teaspoon of vanilla extract to mine. Really good
Simple, easy, and absolutely DeeLicuoUs. The only thing i did add was a splash of pure vanilla extract, which i added to my mixture of milk, flour and sugar. ENJOY!

This recipe was so easy and absolutely delicious. I never thought living overseas I would ever have this all time favorite American dessert. I added some cinnamon less butter and 3/4 sugar and it was superb. Thank you!!
This recipe is really good. We will make it again.

First time making peach cobbler. It was fairly easy. Taste is pretty. Family enjoys it. It's a keeper. The only thing I didn't do was the extra juice from the canned peaches. It seemed to be too much juice. It takes very good.

I added a little raw sugar to the mix and on top too. Plus U can use apple and mixed berry instead of peaches if U like. What ever fruit U like. For this type of dish anyways. Plus a little all spice nutmeg and cinnamon to the mix too.
It was wonderful except a but gooey. Not enough crust texture. But wonderfully tasting
It was amazing
Very easy. Fast!

Just added a dash of cinnamon and kept a little bit of the juice with the peaches, so a little dash of self raising flour on top of the 1/2 a cup, because I had to half the recipe. Also I sprinkled some icing sugar on top. Thanks
I doubled tje recipe but ended up using Bisquick instead of flour turned out good!
Made this ... It says 2 cans peaches with syrup... That's to much. Use only 1 can next time!
this is easy and tastes great
Super easy and delicious!! I'll be making this again!!❤️

DELICIOUS! I followed the recipe exactly, as well as the brown sugar and cinnamon topping. When the 45 mins was up, I put it on broil a couple minutes to brown the top. The cooling is important so it has time to thicken, don't leave that part out.
This is the peach cobbler recipe my mom has been making since I was born! As far as I am concerned it is the best and all others are imposters! LOL
Hello ; This recipe is great but I find that if I add a 1/4 teaaspoon each of cinnamon and nutmag it really adds a lot of flavor. It is really good.
Its absolutely delicious!!! So easy to make. Tadte just like Grandma made it.
Perfect for a gloomy sunday afternoon...
So good so easy
Easy and delicious. Have had requests over and over for it .
My first time making it I did put a tea spoon of cinnamon In itput in while mixing the dry ingredients. Then a little on the top of the peaches
It was easy and delicious!
This recipe was easy to follow and had great taste.
Tastes way better than it looks once done, I also added 3/4 teaspoon cinnamon. Definitely needs the cinnamon.
added cinnamon
It is terrible. Waste of time and money.
I made this tonight for my family for dessert. It was fine so fast I didn’t even get a picture of it. I added a little cinnamon to the batter and it made it amazing.

This is a very versatile recipe. I have made it with many fruits: plums, strawberries, apples, blueberries, and cherries. Anything you can make into a pie or pudding works well. It's become my go-to dish for any get together and people always love it. I do the regular flour with 2 tsp baking powder and cinnamon and nutmeg as others have suggested.

Family loved it. It was very quick and easy to make. Making my second one by family request right now and just put it in the oven. The only thing I did different was, add cinnamon sugar to mine on top of peaches before baking. Yummy with a scoop of ice cream.
I doubled the peaches

I made this recipe for Christmas Day. I preheated a cast iron skillet, sprayed some nonstick cooking spray before literally dumping in the peaches and batter. I served with some vanilla bean ice cream.
Very easy, I doubled the recipe for a larger pan. Also I added Cinnamon, Nutmeg and All Spice. I was gone the same night.

We love it. I followed your recipe and then I Sprinkled cinnamon and brown sugar over the top before putting it in the oven. Keeps 
them coming back for more.
Thanks for helping me in the kitchen.
Denise
It's a great, easy cobbler that also freezes well
This was super easy but I found it came out a little greasy for my taste.
Personally, this recipe didn't work for me. I followed everything perfectly, I have a good oven, but it still turned out quite greasy and chewy.

I’m sure it would be good if you follow the ingredients in the video. Don’t follow the written recipe, it adds an extra can of peaches making gummy peach soup. ????. Original poster might want to edit the written recipe. A lot of people follow the written.
Perfection. The only thing I did was sprinkle cinnamon on top before cooking. Wonderful and easy addition to our Christmas Eve meal.
It’s no fail and oh so scrumptious
If I could give this recipe zero stars I would. I made it exactly as the recipe stated and it turned out to be a soggy sugary buttery disaster.
Wasn’t bad but wasn’t good
It was very very easy and great. I will definitely do it again. I did add almond extract and a pinch of cinnimon

Recipe turned out great. I added a dash of allspice and pure vanilla to batter. I also used half white and half light brown sugar. Taste great right out the oven or reheated with a scoop of ice cream.

I changed the recipe a bit. I cut the amount of butter in half. Used all-purpose flour and added salt and baking powder to it, I also added a bit of cinnamon. Then I did 1 1/2 the amount of batter and drained one of the cans of peaches. I haven't tried the original recipe because it sounded like it was going to be a soupy mess. I think I'd still make some changes to it but it's not bad. A bit sweet.
I made for Bunco. I added some berries. It was so wo
So easy to make & delicious!!
My husband and I LOVED IT...YUM YUM!!! I made it right by Recipe, except had to cook it total of 50 minutes!! Very quick & easy!!
I followed the directions. Perhaps it needed to cook longer? It was more cake like than cobbler. I have other recipes which come out crispy on top. I'll not be making this again.
I changed the pan size 9 3/8 - 9 3/8

Followed the directions but drained half the syrup from peaches as that seemed like way too much liquid. The "crust" became this gelatinous goo. The whole thing was drowning in butter. There is NO way this works for anyone as written.

My family loves this. I made it as directed the first time, but wanted some warm spices added, so on numerous occasions, I’ve added individual spices or a combination thereof of nutmeg, cinnamon, ginger and even a pinch of cloves from time to time. I’ve substituted fruit cocktail, canned pears, even canned pineapple. It’s just a great recipe that is so adaptable. Enjoy.

Mixed all Ingredients except peaches. (Used frozen peaches in purée, more moisture, it way better.) Added a touch of cinnamon with dry ingredients and a hint of vanilla extract in place of a tiny bit of the milk. Cooked for 1 hour and 20 mins instead of 30 to 40 mins. Perfection!

This was atrocious. I made an account just to give this a bad review. The recipe says to leave in the syrup, which then mixed with the dough batter while baking and formed a gross soggy paste. There’s more syrup in the whole recipe than there is dough. Absolutely horrible experience. Syrup started boiling out of the pan and burnt to the oven. If I could give this 0 stars I would.
very easy and very good, my family ate it all.
It was DELICIOUS! I added some nutmeg and cinnamon on top and had it for breakfast. My family and I really enjoyed it! Thank you for this easy and fun recipe!
love it! Super Easy to make!
Very easy to make. I pulled it out of the oven after 50 minutes, but could have cooked longer. It was a bit too sweet for me. I did sprinkle a little cinnamon on top and I think it helped a lot

I have made this several times and it is a big hit w/ my husband. Just two of us, so I use an 8x8 dish and only one can of peaches and only about 2/3 of the butter. However, I make the batter as indicated. Adding a liberal 1/2 tsp of cinnamon and 1/4 tsp of nutmeg is a must. As someone else suggested, I put the butter and peaches on the bottom and pour the batter over. FYI: The batter will be VERY thin and you'll think it won't work, but it does. I don't buy self-rising flour, so I also add 1.5 tsp of baking powder and 1/4 tsp of salt to the flour. I don't think you'll be disappointed in this quick cobbler w/ canned peaches, when you fresh ones are out of season.
I added Oatmeal and followed two other reviews add on and it came out great. It's fast and good.

I looooooove peach cobbler!!. This concept of a peach cobbler was so foreign to me but I decided to go with it but I was prepared to throw it out ...It's actually very good and easy to whip up. My picky Dad wanted to taste a teaspoon..lol but he ended up eating a bowl. He thought the flour mixture taste like a real crust and loved it!!. That's a huge compliment from him. I love rolled out crust and my taste buds didn't really detect a huge difference. The dough mixture is extremely similar to a rolled out crust but softer so this recipe is a winner. I used buttermilk, added 1tsp baking powder and cinnamon in the dough mix. I made the same peach mixture as I would in a regular peach cobbler. Thank you and I will make this again and again.
Yummmmi
I like to add a cup of cottage cheese to the peaches. Gives it a yummy creamy texture
I ?? this recipe. My go to and the family loves it. I sprinkle cinnamon on top before baking and serve with ice cream.
Really easy and versatile. Other canned or frozen fruits can be combined or substituted.
Was very easy. Mine wasnt as pretty though. Served with vanilla icecream. Was delicious
My family loves this cobbler with almost any fruit.

Five stars for ease and limited ingredients but I will not make it as written. It was too much butter and too salty. If I make it again, will use about 1/3 cup unsalted butter. I will also use a smaller baking dish, a 9 x 9 instead of 9 x 13....or double the ingredients for a 9 x 13. And, I would add the vanilla and perhaps some spices.
Help mi s doesn’t get crusty on top. It’s like bread on the bottom and peaches and a thick juice on top

I’m 7 months pregnant and I couldn’t stop craving cobbler and I found this! Admittedly I hate to be one of those people BUT I didn’t have quite everything exactly so here’s what I changed: I used baking powder and salt to make my all purpose flour, self rising flour. I also used one can of peach slices and one can pears but both were in lite syrup so I drained the pears completely and drained about 1/3 of the peaches. I also sprinkled maybe a 1/2 tsp of cinnamon on top before baking and added 3tbsp of cubed butter on top at the end of baking. I really dislike watery/soupy cobbler so this turned out PERFECT. It’s sooo good and buttery. The pears don’t really do anything for the flavor and after baking it’s texture isn’t really too much different from the peaches. It’s still very peachy, the pears just seem to add more substance so it’s not all bread.

This came out awesome! I think I used every suggestion mentioned from the reviews! Didn’t have self-rising flour, so I added 2 teaspoons of baking powder, I used 1/2 brown and 1/2 white sugar, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, and 1/2 tsp cinnamon. I also added 1/2 tsp of vanilla. Sprinkled peaches with a little cinnamon and nutmeg and followed the cooking instructions exactly : melt butter in pan, pour in batter, pour in peaches. Came out great!

The only change I made was I cooked mine for 40 mins at 350 and then for 10 more mins at 325 and it still seemed kinda doughy in the middle, more than I personally like it, but it was still firm and done as it was intended to be I believe!
Yeah it was fast, but the finished product was swimming in butter (and not good).

I used 2 cups of macerated mulberries instead of peaches. I don't know what went wrong. The cobbler didn't bake up around the berries like I expected. It looks like buttery fry bread along the edges. I've done this recipe before and it worked beautifully with the peaches but these berries kicked my butt.
Absolutely will make it again!

I was really disappointed with this recipe. As recommended by other commenters, I added some cinnamon and a bit of nutmeg to the recipe. Had I not done that, I'm sure I'd now be rating it one star. Even my three dessert-loving kids and husband were unimpressed. I'd maybe try this again using Bisquick and less butter but not as written.
Delicious recipe
I love this easy recipe!

I followed this recipe exactly as written and watched the video twice. Needless to say, 40 minutes have passed and I can't see past the butter to see the crust. I pulled it out and put a fork in it to check the consistency as it still looked soupy. Not at all impressed with this recipe.
It was super tasty! I will definitely make it again!

I cut this recipe in half and it still turned out just perfect! It was fast, easy and delicious. It took a little longer to bake because we were using a toaster oven, 40min+. Will definitely be making this again.
Perfect!
i substituted splenda for sugar my wife is diabetic
Amazing Super simple!
I added 1 tsp cinnamon to the flour mixture and made a topping using 1 C of flour, 1/2 C of dark brown sugar and 1/2 C of cubed butter crumbling it together and put on top before baking.
I made it with a little less sugar and used canned peaches and it was really good. A quick easy recipe I would definitely make again.
I made mine in a 10” cast iron skillet. Baked for an hour. Easy and delicious!!!

I only had a large can of peaches instead of 2 small ones so I had to pour the juice out and divide it in half. Also the peaches I had were canned in 100% juice instead of heavy syrup. When I got ready to mix the batter I made a mistake and added my syrup to the batter instead of the peaches. It should have been a recipe for disaster and I wanted to cry when I realized what I had done, but I need a dessert for church so I carried on. Despite everything it turned out wonderfully and was the hit of the dinner. While there were leftovers for the other cakes and pies mine was completely gone. No one minded that it wasn't as sweet as it would have been had the peaches been in heavy syrup. The only thing I would change is to maybe add some cinnamon next time.

This was tasty! I did not have self-rising flour so I followed others suggestion of adding 2tsp of baking powder to all-purpose flour (and about 1/4 tsp of salt). I used margarine instead of butter because that's what I had. I had two 15oz can of peaches (one off brand and one can Del Monte spiced peaches)--I used all of the peaches and most of the syrup (maybe too much syrup?). I had to bake it 1hr but it was quick and easy!
Yes! I will make this again. It is a party favorite!
It was easy and i will make it again. Delicious.
Taste just like homemade old-fashioned that my grandma made. So easy!
It was ok I did a little extra crust

Very disappointed. I'm new to cooking/baking, so I wanted to follow the recipe as listed even though I saw comment after comment about different things that went wrong. I should have listened! 

This was VERY BUTTERY, I mean my whole apartment smelled like butter for hours afterwards, sickeningly so. The cobbler itself was inedible, there was just no way to get past the butter taste and smell. 

Also, as some other reviewers have pointed out this takes longer than 30-40 minutes to make. When I took it out it was around an hour, and it still looked like it could use a few more minutes.

This was my first dud recipe. :\

I had jars of peaches that were 24 oz not the oz. called for. Used that and it was fine. Did not add the juice as it was light, not heavy. Maybe added a pinch more of spices, etc. to make up for it. Yummy
Loved it
